On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Issue was reported in the PROD environment.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Another user reported the described issue:
- SD card was connected to computer.
  --> see screenshot "SD_card_BW10985937.jpg" attached.
- Card does not appear in the EPP client console.
- As a result, the external card cannot be unblocked.
- Access is denied to the SD card in the Windows Explorer.
  --> see screenshot "EM_BW10985937.jpg" attached.
- There are no logs about this process on the server console.
Result:
Unblocking and whitelisting the SD card does not work!
Expectation:
Please analyze this behavior.
Log file "BW10985937.zip" has been uploaded on the website.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: The customer returned with the following information.
after analyzing log file “eppclient.log” the following device has been whitelisted using VID, PID and SN:

    Device type: Card Reader Device (MTD)(12) 38 00000257B9571F80
    vid, pid, sn: 10EC,5261,00000001004CE00000
    connection_mode: 1, last_connect_time: 2024-10-01 13:15:41

Reason:

    10-01 13:15:41.567 16748 DEBUG  enumerate: Card Reader Device (MTD)(12) PCIVEN_10EC&DEV_5261&SUBSYS_886D103C&REV_0100000001004CE00000 devFlags: x0180200a [DevicesStorageList::SetConnected DevicesStorageList.cpp:384
    10-01 13:15:54.544 18496 DEBUG  enumerate: Card Reader Device (MTD)(12) PCIVEN_10EC&DEV_5261&SUBSYS_886D103C&REV_0100000001004CE00000 devFlags: x0180200a [DevicesStorageList::SetConnected DevicesStorageList.cpp:384]
    10-01 13:15:54.805 16748 DEBUG  enumerate: Card Reader Device (MTD)(12) PCIVEN_10EC&DEV_5261&SUBSYS_886D103C&REV_0100000001004CE00000 devFlags: x0180200a [DevicesStorageList::SetConnected DevicesStorageList.cpp:384]

Remark:

From my point of view, it makes no sense to whitelist the Internal Card Reader(6) device as well as there are no “DEBUG  enumerate” listed in the logs for this device.

Does this consideration make sense?

Result:

    According to the affected user, using SD card now works.
    After connecting the SD card is unblocked.
    Log files of the SD card connection process are still not available on the server console.


Thank you for the workaround!

Please still analyze and check, why SD cards are not listed in EPP client console and why there are no logs from connected SD cards on the server console.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Hello team,
The customer got back to this ticket replying as seen below:

"As testing was not possible so far, please reopen the ticket again. Testing is expected to be carried out this week."

So please reopen the ticket as requested by them, and hopefully they will deliver a result by the end of this week.
Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Please reopen the ticket.

The customer has reported that the testing has been carried out.

 Initial situation:

- User is connecting a SD card to a computer. The SD card appears in the Windows Explorer, but there is no access to the card.
- The Endpoint Protector PopUp window does not turn up to unblock the card.
- The SD card (reader) is not displayed in the EPP client!
- There are also no logs from the SD card connection process on the server console.
 

Expectation:

- After connecting the SD card should be blocked because the device type is "Card Reader Device (MTD)”
- The EEP window should turn up to unblock the SD card.
- The SD card (reader) should be displayed in the EPP client!
- Log reports should be generated from the SD card connection process on the server console.
 

Testing results with Unify server version 7.2.0:

- The SD card (reader) is now displayed in the EPP client!
- The Endpoint Protector PopUp window does not turn up to unblock the card, because the SD card (reader) is already unblocked, even though it is not whitelisted, or access is allowed!
- There are still no logs from the SD card connection process on the server console.
 

Please continue investigating why the SD card is not blocked now.

Log files “LMUC1095068_2025_03_14.zip” have been uploaded to vendor website.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Radu-Mihai Popa:

I have tested with 2 external card readers, one that is generic, and one from Dlink, both function as expected,, and the SD Card can be blocked/unblocked without issues. Tested using the internal SD Card reader, the device works as expected ( the device is of type SCSI ). 

Is the Card reader ( not clear if internal or external ) properly identified? ( SCSI, MTD, or Internal).

[DevOps CommentId:11838517]

Is the Card reader ( not clear if internal or external ) properly identified? ( SCSI, MTD, or Internal).

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Account ACV has been changed to 1695173.28.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Mihaela-Cristina Benta:

We were connected and found out that the problem was that an SD card was allowed when the rights were set to deny. This was because the connection between the unify and nodes was not done correctly and when the right was deleted from unify it couldn't be deleted from nodes. We made the connection ok, so all the modifications made after to be executed ok and we deleted the right from the nodes, that was deleted on unify server.
After the modification took place ok, they wanted to self remediate but they expected the self remediate popup to show automatically, which it did not. They said that this ticket could be closed and open a new ticket for the behavior of the self remediate poupup.

@Cecilia-Maria Iepure  @Ionut-Alexandru Urean @Alin Anca

[DevOps CommentId:11887037]

Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: I am waiting on confirmation from the customer that it is ok, and I'll get back to you after that.
Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Client.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Hello @Cecilia,
Please see the customer's reply below, and respond to their points in order for us to be able to close this:

in yesterday's meeting, you resolved the problem:

- The SD card reader is blocked again.
- Unblocking the SD card is only possible after manual approval.
 

Attention:

- After connecting the SD card to the computer, no Self “Remediate” pop-up window appears for manual approval.
- The window must be triggered via the Endpoint Protector console.
- Ticket 00440963 has been created regarding this topic.
 

Please briefly summarize the following again:

- What was the cause of the problem?
- How was it resolved?
- How can it be prevented in the future?
 
The ticket can then be closed.

Thank you!

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Mihaela-Cristina Benta:

Hi @Alin Anca
- What was the cause of the problem?
  The problem was caused by the fact that on the nodes the traffic was high due to logs or some prevoius action and when a right was deleted from unify console, it wasn't deleted from the nodes.

- How was it resolved?
  We deleted the right that was deleted from the unify console also from the nodes.
 
- How can it be prevented in the future?
 If you add multiple rights, please verify that those right are taken into consideration and after add more..if the right is not being added just remove it and add it again...because it might be a communication error due to load...

[DevOps CommentId:11903585]

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: The customer has returned with the below reply:

a few comments/questions on point 3: How can it be prevented in the future?

 - No rights were added here! Only a single global right was removed on the Unify server.
So, my question:
How can Netwrix ensure that removing and adding a global right definitely works?
- “If you add multiple rights, please verify that those right are taken into consideration”
How can actually be checked whether added rights are being taken into consideration?
Usually, after adding a global right, the affected user is checked to see whether, for example, access is functional.

On Escalation Ticket # 00421650 the new comment has been added: Mihai Rosca:

@WaitingOnEngineer @Cecilia-Maria Iepure @Alin Anca One solution to verify this issue, in case there is a suspicion it might still occur, would be to reuse the same device on two different endpoints to see if the behavior is consistent and if the global rights are at fault. 
As to prevention, currently we consider this occurrence to have been remote with very low probability of it happening again in the future.
